item.title: Delhi polls: BJP releases 'Aarop Patra' against AAP government; Kejriwal reacts - The Times of India
item.description:
Delhi polls: BJP releases 'Aarop Patra' against AAP government; Kejriwal reacts

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

The BJP has released an 'Aarop Patra' (chargesheet) against the AAP government in anticipation of the upcoming Delhi elections. AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal has provided a strong reaction to the claims made by the BJP.

  • BJP highlights alleged failures and corruption of the AAP government.
  • Kejriwal counters with accusations of political mudslinging.
  • The political climate in Delhi is heating up as elections approach.
'We will combat these false accusations with facts and figures,' stated Kejriwal during a press conference.

The upcoming elections promise to be contentious as both parties gear up for a battle of narratives.

item.title: Sunny Leone gets monthly grant under Chhattisgarh govt scheme. But there's a twist - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Sunny Leone gets monthly grant under Chhattisgarh govt scheme. But there's a twist

Date: Dec 23, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

A man in Chhattisgarh has fraudulently opened an account in the name of actress Sunny Leone to illegally receive monthly government grants designated for women.

  • The Chhattisgarh government provides ₹1,000 every month to married women through the 'Mahtari Vandan Yojana'.
  • Virendra Joshi allegedly opened the account under Sunny Leone's name and has been receiving money illegally.
  • Authorities are investigating the case and have frozen the fraudulent account.
  • The discovery has led to political tensions between the BJP and Congress parties regarding the effectiveness of the scheme.
Deepak Baij of Congress claims that over 50% of beneficiaries of the Mahtari Vandan Yojana are fake.

This incident highlights issues of fraud and portrayal of social welfare programs while raising questions about beneficiary verification processes.

item.title: 18% GST on caramelised popcorn sparks meme fest online. Best ones here - India Today
item.description:
18% GST on Caramelised Popcorn Sparks Online Meme Fest

Published On: Dec 23, 2024 | Source: India Today

The GST Council’s decision to impose an 18% GST on caramelised popcorn has ignited a wave of memes on social media.

  • Unpacked and unlabelled salted popcorn: 5% GST
  • Pre-packed and labelled ready-to-eat popcorn: 12% GST
  • Caramelised popcorn: 18% GST
One user joked about eating their last packet of caramelised popcorn before the price surges.

The humorous reactions indicate the complexity of tax classifications and the rise of popcorn as a ‘luxury’ item online.

item.title: Steering, Throttle Fault May Be Behind Mumbai Ferry Crash, Crew Knew: Sources - NDTV
item.description:
Steering, Throttle Fault May Be Behind Mumbai Ferry Crash, Crew Knew: Sources

Published on December 18, Source: Mumbai News

The recent collision between a Navy boat and a passenger ferry in Mumbai resulted in tragic losses, likely due to technical issues with the naval vessel.

  • The incident occurred on December 18, resulting in 15 deaths.
  • A technical malfunction in the steering assembly and throttle quadrant is believed to be the cause.
  • The Navy boat was reportedly speeding and lost control before the collision.
  • The ferry was carrying over 100 passengers and sank in the Arabian Sea.
  • Of the 113 people on both vessels, 15 perished, and 98 were rescued.
  • The ferry was overloaded, surpassing its licensed passenger capacity.
  • The Maharashtra Maritime Board has initiated an investigation and cancelled the ferry's license.
“The crew was aware of the malfunction when the collision took place.” - Survivor from the Navy vessel

The tragedy highlights significant safety concerns in maritime operations and calls for a thorough investigation into the events leading to the accident.

item.title: Chandrababu Naidu & Revanth Reddy: A Meeting in Davos? - Gulte
item.description:
Chandrababu Naidu & Revanth Reddy: A Meeting in Davos?

Published on: 12:06 pm, 23 December 2024

The chief ministers of the Telugu states, Chandrababu Naidu and Revanth Reddy, are set to attend the upcoming World Economic Forum Summit in Davos, which begins on January 20. While this may be an opportunity for them to meet, their attendance will be in an individual capacity rather than a bilateral meeting.

  • Both leaders have previously met to discuss post-bifurcation issues.
  • This will be Naidu’s first trip to Davos during his second tenure as a chief minister.
  • Revanth Reddy continues the tradition of attending the summit.
  • Maharashtra's chief minister Devendra Fadnavis will also be at Davos.
“It has to be seen if they will orchestrate a meeting here to discuss political affairs of Telugu states.”

The upcoming summit presents a significant platform for political discussions among the Telugu CMs, which could influence the region's governance.

item.title: Rozgar Mela | Record govt jobs provided in one-and-a-half years, says PM Modi - The Hindu
item.description:
PM Modi Announces Record Government Jobs at Rozgar Mela

Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi distributed over 71,000 appointment letters to newly appointed recruits, claiming his government has provided nearly 10 lakh permanent government jobs in the past year and a half.

  • More than 71,000 appointment letters were distributed through video conferencing.
  • Nearly 10 lakh permanent government jobs have been provided in the last one and a half years.
  • Focus on youth, honesty, and transparency in the recruitment process.
  • Government initiatives include 26-week maternity leave helping women in their careers.
  • Recruitment efforts have seen a significant rise in women and candidates from OBC, SC, and ST categories.
"Rozgar Melas are empowering the youth and unlocking their potential. Best wishes to the newly inducted appointees." — Narendra Modi

The government aims for maximal utilization of Indian youth talents through various development schemes and educational reforms.

item.title: Bengaluru Volvo SUV crash: How a 'mindless' car driver and an aluminium-laden truck wiped out IT firm CEO - The Times of India
item.description:
Bengaluru Volvo SUV crash: How a 'mindless' car driver and an aluminium-laden truck wiped out IT firm CEO, his family

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

A tragic incident occurred in Bengaluru involving a Volvo SUV, claiming the lives of an IT firm CEO and his family. The crash was attributed to reckless driving by a car and an overweight truck laden with aluminum.

  • The CEO and his family were pronounced dead at the scene following the accident.
  • Witnesses described the events as horrifying, detailing the speed and lack of caution exhibited by the vehicles involved.
  • The incident has sparked discussions regarding road safety and the need for stricter traffic regulations.
  • Authorities are investigating the circumstances surrounding the crash and whether any legal actions will be pursued against the negligent drivers.
“This tragedy reminds us of the fragility of life and the importance of safety on the roads,” said a local community leader.

This unfortunate event underlines the urgent need for increased awareness and enforcement of road safety measures to prevent similar accidents in the future.

item.title: Assam Police SI Admit Card 2024 Live: SLPRB admit card released at slprbassam.in, direct link - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Assam Police SI Admit Card 2024 Live Updates

Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Assam Police Sub Inspector recruitment admit card has been released today. Candidates can access it through the SLPRB Assam's official website.

  • The written examination is scheduled for January 5, 2025.
  • Candidates must bring the admit card and a government-issued photo ID to the exam.
  • To download the admit card, candidates need to enter their application number, name, and date of birth.
  • SLPRB is conducting recruitment for various Sub Inspector positions.
“Candidates must ensure all details are correct on the admit card and report any discrepancies to the technical support.”

For updates, candidates should regularly check the SLPRB website.

item.title: 3 Marriages, Rs 1.25 Crore: How 'Looteri Dulhan' Targeted Rich Men - NDTV
item.description:
3 Marriages, Rs 1.25 Crore: How 'Looteri Dulhan' Targeted Rich Men

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

A woman has been arrested over a decade after marrying a series of men and extracting over ₹ 1.25 crore from them under the pretext of settlements.

  • Seema, also known as Nikki, first married a businessman from Agra in 2013 and received ₹ 75 lakh after filing a case against his family.
  • In 2017, she married a software engineer from Gurugram, taking an additional ₹ 10 lakh after their separation.
  • Her latest marriage was to a businessman from Jaipur in 2023, from whom she fled with cash and jewellery worth ₹ 36 lakh.
“Police investigation revealed that Seema sought her victims on matrimonial sites, focusing on men who were divorced or widowed.”

This case highlights the alarming trend of individuals exploiting matrimonial platforms for financial gain.

item.title: Narayana Murthy Says Climate Change May Trigger Mass Migration To Bengaluru, Pune - NDTV
item.description:
Narayana Murthy Says Climate Change May Trigger Mass Migration To Bengaluru, Pune

Publication Date: March 18, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Narayana Murthy, Infosys co-founder, emphasizes the urgent need for climate action, warning that climate change could lead to mass migration towards urban areas like Bengaluru, Pune, and Hyderabad due to uninhabitable rural regions.

  • Murthy warns of the significant risks posed by climate change, specifically related to mass migration.
  • He predicts that certain rural areas in India may become uninhabitable within 20-25 years.
  • Urban centers are already facing issues, including pollution and traffic congestion.
  • Urgent cooperation among corporate, political, and bureaucratic sectors is essential to tackle these challenges.
  • Murthy expresses optimism about achieving climate targets by 2030.
“What is likely to happen is that there will be a mass migration from rural parts of states... into habitable places like Bangalore, maybe Pune, maybe Hyderabad.” - Narayana Murthy

Given India's rapid urbanization, the anticipated influx of migrants due to climate change could worsen the already strained infrastructure and resources of urban centers.

item.title: 100 Important Supreme Court Judgments Of 2024 - Part 2 [26-50] - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
100 Important Supreme Court Judgments Of 2024 - Part 2 [26-50]

Publication Date: 2024 LiveLaw

The article discusses significant Supreme Court judgments delivered in 2024, focusing on 25 key cases. These judgments address various issues including consumer rights, parental alienation, juvenile justice, climate change, and the portrayal of persons with disabilities.

  • Indian Medical Association v. Union of India: Landmark ruling protecting consumers from misleading advertisements.
  • Parental Alienation Syndrome: Explored in custody disputes affecting children's rights.
  • Juvenile Justice Act: 30-day time limit set for appeals against preliminary assessment orders.
  • Sub-Classification of Scheduled Castes: Permitting separate quotas for more backward sub-categories.
  • Climate Change Rights: Recognition of a distinct right to be free from adverse effects of climate change.
  • Guidelines for Media: Issued for the portrayal of persons with disabilities.
  • Prosecution of Crimes: Cannot be withdrawn solely due to the accused's public status.
“The fundamental right to health encompasses the right of a consumer to be made aware of the quality of products being offered for sale.”

This summary highlights the implications of these rulings on various facets of Indian law and society.

item.title: Grenade attack in Gurdaspur: Three Khalistan Zindabad Force members gunned down in encounter in Pilibhit - The Hindu
item.description:
Grenade Attack in Gurdaspur: Encounter in Pilibhit Claims Lives of Three Khalistan Zindabad Force Suspects

Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Three terror suspects linked to a grenade attack in Gurdaspur were killed in a police encounter in Pilibhit, considered a significant victory against the Khalistan Zindabad Force.

  • Suspects identified as Gurvinder Singh, Virender Singh, and Jaspreet Singh, all from Gurdaspur, Punjab.
  • The encounter occurred in Puranpur, Uttar Pradesh, early on December 23, 2024.
  • Weapons seized included two AK-47 rifles and two Glock pistols along with ammunition.
  • Punjab's Director General of Police highlighted this as a major breakthrough against the terror module.
  • All three suspects succumbed to injuries sustained in the encounter.
  • Investigation into their terror connections is ongoing.
“In a major breakthrough against a Pak-sponsored Khalistan Zindabad Force terror module, a joint operation led to an encounter with three module members.” – Gaurav Yadav, Punjab DGP

This encounter marks a significant step in tackling terror activities associated with the Khalistan Zindabad Force in the region, furthering efforts to ensure public safety.

item.title: BCI rules don't allow women lawyers to appear before Court with face covered: Jammu & Kashmir High Court - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
BCI rules don't allow women lawyers to appear before Court with face covered: Jammu & Kashmir High Court

Published on: 23 Dec 2024, 4:19 am

The High Court of Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh ruled that the Bar Council of India’s rules do not permit women lawyers to appear with their faces covered. This decision was prompted by a case where a lawyer appeared with a face cover and refused to remove it.

  • The Court sought clarification on whether the rules allow women advocates to cover their faces.
  • Justice Moksha Khajuria Kazmi observed that the BCI rules do not mention such rights.
  • The case involved an advocate named Syed Ainain Qadri, who claimed her right to appear with a face cover.
  • The court did not allow her appearance since her identity could not be confirmed.
  • The petition was ultimately dismissed after finding an alternative remedy available.
“This court does not entertain the appearance of the person identifying herself to be Advocate Ms.Syed Ainain Qadri as counsel for the petitioners as this Court has no basis/occasion to confirm her actual identity both as a person as well as professional.” - Justice Rahul Bharti

The ruling clarifies the dress code for female advocates and emphasizes the importance of identity verification in court proceedings.

item.title: Trump appoints Indian-American entrepreneur Sriram Krishnan as senior policy advisor on Artificial Intelligence - The Hindu
item.description:
Trump Appoints Sriram Krishnan as Senior Policy Advisor on AI

Publication Date: December 23, 2024

Source: The Hindu

U.S. President-elect Donald Trump has appointed Indian-American entrepreneur Sriram Krishnan as Senior White House Policy Advisor on Artificial Intelligence.

  • Sriram Krishnan previously worked at Microsoft, Twitter, Yahoo!, Facebook, and Snap.
  • He will collaborate with David O. Sacks, who is appointed as the AI & Crypto Czar.
  • Krishnan aims to ensure continued American leadership in AI and shape AI policy across the government.
  • His appointment has been positively received by the Indian-American community.
“I’m honored to be able to serve our country and ensure continued American leadership in AI working closely with David Sacks.” — Sriram Krishnan (@sriramk) December 22, 2024

Krishnan's extensive background in technology and policy positions him well for this significant role.

item.title: Trump appoints Indian American entrepreneur Sriram Krishnan as senior policy advisor on Artificial Intelligence - The Hindu
item.description:
Trump Appoints Sriram Krishnan as Senior Policy Advisor on AI

Publication Date: December 23, 2024

Source: The Hindu

U.S. President-elect Donald Trump has appointed Indian American entrepreneur Sriram Krishnan as Senior White House Policy Advisor on Artificial Intelligence.

  • Sriram Krishnan previously worked at Microsoft, Twitter, Yahoo!, Facebook, and Snap.
  • He will collaborate with David O. Sacks, the White House AI & Crypto Czar.
  • Krishnan aims to ensure continued American leadership in AI and coordinate AI policy across the government.
  • His appointment has been positively received by the Indian American community.
“I’m honored to be able to serve our country and ensure continued American leadership in AI working closely with David Sacks.” – Sriram Krishnan

Krishnan's experience in public policy and technology is expected to benefit his role significantly.

item.title: 3 pro-Khalistan terrorists killed in police encounter in UP's Pilibhit - The Times of India
item.description:
3 Pro-Khalistan Terrorists Killed in Police Encounter in UP's Pilibhit

Date: October 20, 2023 | Source: Times of India

A recent police encounter in Pilibhit, Uttar Pradesh, resulted in the death of three individuals linked to the pro-Khalistan movement during an operation aimed at curbing extremist activities in the region.

  • The terrorists were reportedly involved in planning violent acts targeting various establishments.
  • Authorities noted that the operation was part of a larger initiative to enhance security and prevent the spread of extremism in Uttar Pradesh.
  • The encounter involved heavy gunfire and was conducted after extensive intelligence gathering.
"Our forces are committed to ensuring the safety of the public and will take strict action against those promoting violence and disruption." - Police spokesperson

In conclusion, the operation serves as a reminder of ongoing security challenges posed by extremist groups and the need for vigilant actions by law enforcement to maintain peace.

item.title: IIM Ahmedabad MBA Admission: Check eligibility criteria, selection process - Hindustan Times
item.description:
IIM Ahmedabad MBA Admission: Eligibility and Selection Process Explained

Date: Dec 23, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Indian Institute of Management (IIM) Ahmedabad has outlined the admission process for its flagship MBA program, which includes several steps such as tests and interviews.

  • The admission process involves the CAT/GMAT, followed by an analytical writing test and personal interviews.
  • Eligibility requires a bachelor's degree with at least 50% marks (45% for reserved categories).
  • Final year students can apply with appropriate documentation.
  • Indian candidates will be screened based on CAT 2024 scores.

“At different stages of the selection process, IIM Ahmedabad will use application rating (AR) score.”

For more detailed information on admission, candidates can reach out to IIM Ahmedabad's Admissions Office.
